entities.name: NVIDIA CORPORATION
entities.description: NVIDIA Corporation is a technology company that pioneered accelerated computing to solve challenging computational problems. It has expanded from PC graphics to fields like scientific computing, AI, data science, AV, robotics, AR, and VR. Headquartered in Santa Clara, California, it was incorporated in California in 1993 and reincorporated in Delaware in 1998.

entities.name: S&P 500 INDEX
entities.description: The S&P 500 Index is a stock market index that measures the stock performance of 500 large companies listed on stock exchanges in the United States. NVIDIA Corporation's common stock is a component of this index.

entities.name: NASDAQ 100 INDEX
entities.description: The Nasdaq 100 Index is a stock market index made up of 100 of the largest non-financial companies listed on the Nasdaq stock market. NVIDIA Corporation's common stock is a component of this index.

entities.name: SOFTBANK
entities.description: SoftBank is a Japanese multinational conglomerate that was involved in a terminated Share Purchase Agreement with NVIDIA Corporation to sell Arm due to significant regulatory challenges.

entities.name: ARM
entities.description: Arm is a semiconductor and software design company that was supposed to be acquired by NVIDIA Corporation from SoftBank, but the agreement was terminated due to regulatory challenges.

relationships.relationship_description: NVIDIA Corporation's common stock is a component of the S&P 500 Index, and its performance is compared with this index.
NVIDIA Corporation's common stock is a component of the Nasdaq 100 Index, and its performance is compared with this index.
NVIDIA Corporation and SoftBank had a Share Purchase Agreement for NVIDIA to acquire Arm, which was terminated due to regulatory challenges.
NVIDIA Corporation intended to acquire Arm from SoftBank, but the acquisition was terminated due to regulatory challenges.
SoftBank was the owner of Arm and was involved in a Share Purchase Agreement to sell Arm to NVIDIA Corporation, which was terminated due to regulatory challenges.
